name: ImageS3
body: ImageS3 is an free and open image hosting service for developers. It is designed to store, resize and manage images for all your web and mobile apps in one place. ##Features * Create image plants to organize and store images on Amazon S3. * Design templates for resizing images into pixels or percents on demand. * REST APIs for easy application integration. * Web-based admin tool with live monitoring. ##Installation Download and unzip the compressed package: $ curl -O https://github.com/gogoup/images3-dist/raw/master/images3-play-latest.zip $ unzip images3-play-latest.zip Update the following properties: * 'imagecontent.download.dir' in images3-play-/conf/imagecontent.properties. * 'image.processing.tempdir' in images3-play-/conf/imageprocessor.properties * 'mongodb.url', 'mongodb.port', 'mongodb.username' and 'mongodb.password' in images3-play-/conf/mongodb.properties Enable execution persmissions: $ chmod +x images3-play-/bin/* ##Running $ ./images3-play-0.1.0/bin/images3-play Open [http://localhost:9000](http://localhost:9000) in your browser, you will see the admin tool: #[](http://i.imgur.com/RcY9QQa.png) You can run ImageS3 on different port, for example 8080: $ ./images3-play-0.1.0/bin/images3-play -Dhttp.port=8080 ##License Released under the Apache License 2.0
